title: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Courcoulas 2014
citeAs: ComparativeEvidence: Mean difference in HbA1c between Surgery and Medical/Lifestyle groups in Courcoulas 2014 [Evidence]. Contributors: Brian S. Alper [Authors/Creators]. Computable resource at: https://fevir.net/resources/Evidence/47740.

targetAttachment.title: Figure 2C Metabolic Surgery in the Treatment Algorithm for Type 2 Diabetes: A Joint Statement by International Diabetes Organizations [Journal Article]. Contributors: Francesco Rubino, David M Nathan, Robert H Eckel, Philip R Schauer, K George M M Alberti, Paul Z Zimmet, Stefano Del Prato, Linong Ji, Shaukat M Sadikot, William H Herman, Stephanie A Amiel, Lee M Kaplan, Gaspar Taroncher-Oldenburg, David E Cummings, Delegates of the 2nd Diabetes Surgery Summit. In: Diabetes care, PMID 27222544. Published June 2016. Available at: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27222544/.

note.text: Mean HbA1c at 12 months in Courcoulas 2014 was 6.6 % in Surgery group (n = 41) and 7.0% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 17)

description: Mean HbA1c at 12 months in Courcoulas 2014 was 6.6 % in Surgery group (n = 41) and 7.0% in Medical/Lifestyle group (n = 17), mean difference -0.40% (95% CI -0.89% to 0.09%)

variableDefinition.description: 58 patients aged 25 to 55 with T2DM and BMI 30 to 40

observed.display: GroupAssignment: Bariatric Surgery vs. no bariatric surgery

variableDefinition.description: Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass, Laparoscopic Adjustable Gastric Banding vs. medical treatment (Medical Weight Management MWM)

name: ComparativeEvidence_Mean_difference_in_HbA1c_between_Surgery_and_Medical_Lifestyle_groups_in_Courcoulas_2014
